text: shopping used to be like this but it's
been ages since I went to a mall because
not only am i shopping online more I'm
using services that do my shopping for
me and I don't mean just the ones that
will pick up your dinner or run your
errands or buy your groceries for you in
all those cases you still have to know
what you want I'm talking about the next
evolution sites that will do the
choosing for you the beauty store
Birchbox wine clubs like Club W and the
clothing site stitch fix are great
examples Birchbox sends you beauty
samples every month and if you like them
you can order the full size versions on
their site club W sends bottles of wine
that you can rate later to refine your
choices and of course buy more and then
stitch fix is like a personal stylist
they pick out a box of clothes and send
it to you and whatever you like you pay
for and keep whatever you don't like you
send back but they're all totally
personalized I fill out an online
profile and then they know what to send
me so with Birchbox I might say that I'm
a Caucasian female who really likes lip
gloss Club W finds out that I'd like two
bottles of white not too sweet and one
bottle of red not too dry and then
stitch fix finds out that I am really
tall I like mostly solid colors that are
a mix of classic and bohemian then they
worry about the details and just send me
stuff
it's companies like stitch fix that are
leading this trend towards curated
personalized online shopping ironically
new we really think it's working order
is being a lot of the inspiration for
the service I think there was a time
when brick-and-mortar was a place of
high service where there were a store
associates who knew you well and knew
your preference as well and we're able
to actually capture that in a scalable
way online so what happens if everybody
just starts staying at home and never
going to stores because someone else is
shopping for them well
retail is a little worried Nordstrom
recently bought Trump Club which is a
lot like stitch fix except it's for men
and it's more expensive and then you
have big mall owners like Westfield
group which are trying to make shopping
more convenient and futuristic they have
digital store friends and even a new app
that lets you order a head from the food
court for pickup or delivery consumers
are demanding information on stores and
offers and things that are happening
around them and so as a result retailers
are having to adjust their models to be
more conducive to that type of
environment I think everybody walks into
a mall and generally knows how to get
from point A to point B but nobody
necessarily knows where all the brown
shoes and where are all the specials on
certain types of blouses so marrying
that type of discovery we've seen online
with physical world navigation or
definitely where I see big big
opportunities I guess the thing that I
really like about curated online
shopping is that it feels like there's a
personal touch
even though it's a shopping website and
even though the mall is coming a long
way I'm still just another face in the
crowd
